medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Six years before admission, pneumonia developed, and asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease were diagnosed. The patient experienced pneumonia and sinusitis at least twice a year. Hypogammaglobulinemia was detected three years prior to admission. Immune globulin was administered every 6 weeks, reducing pneumonia frequency until 14 months before admission when coverage was discontinued. Thirty-seven days before admission, the patient experienced exacerbation of bronchoconstriction, leading to hospitalization with rhonchi and wheezes noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension with cardiomegaly, corticosteroid myopathy, and a 45-pack-year smoking history discontinued six years prior to admission.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of emphysema; mother died of hypertension; several children have asthma.
